semantic_title: Excludes Notes: Two Types of Exclusion Instructions with Different Rules
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 12. Excludes Notes

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM has two types of excludes notes. Each type of note has a different definition for use, but they are all similar in that they indicate that codes excluded from each other are independent of each other. a. Excludes1 - A type 1 Excludes note is a pure excludes note. It means 'NOT CODED HERE!' An Excludes1 note indicates that the code excluded should never be used at the same time as the code above the Excludes1 note. An Excludes1 is used when two conditions cannot occur together, such as a congenital form versus an acquired form of the same condition. (Evidence: pg no: 9, L78-L82)
content.summary: Introduces two types of Excludes notes with different usage rules, defining Excludes1 as a pure exclusion meaning codes cannot be used together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L78-L82)
key_concepts: ICD-10-CM has two types of excludes notes (Evidence: pg no: 9, L79)
Each type has different definition for use (Evidence: pg no: 9, L79)
Excluded codes are independent of each other (Evidence: pg no: 9, L80)
Excludes1 means 'NOT CODED HERE!' (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81)
Excludes1 codes should never be used together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81-L82)
Used when conditions cannot occur together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L82)

detailed_rules.rule_text: ICD-10-CM has two types of excludes notes with different definitions for use (Evidence: pg no: 9, L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: The classification system uses two distinct types of exclusion notes, each with specific rules and applications (Evidence: pg no: 9, L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Codes excluded from each other are independent of each other (Evidence: pg no: 9, L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: Excluded codes represent separate, independent conditions that have specific relationship rules (Evidence: pg no: 9, L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Excludes1 means 'NOT CODED HERE!' and codes should never be used at the same time (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81-L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: Excludes1 is a pure exclusion indicating that the excluded code cannot be assigned simultaneously with the code above the note (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81-L82)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Excludes1 is used when two conditions cannot occur together, such as congenital versus acquired forms (Evidence: pg no: 9, L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: Excludes1 notes appear when conditions are mutually exclusive by nature, such as different forms of the same condition that cannot coexist (Evidence: pg no: 9, L82)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify Excludes notes under codes being considered
Step 2: Determine if note is Excludes1 or Excludes2
Step 3: For Excludes1, ensure excluded codes are not used together
Step 4: Verify code selection follows exclusion rules

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has acquired heart condition (cannot also have congenital form)
step_by_step: Step 1: Locate acquired heart condition code
Step 3: Note that congenital form is excluded
Step 4: Assign only the acquired condition code

correct_coding.rationale: Excludes1 prevents using both congenital and acquired codes together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81-L82)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Excludes1 prohibits simultaneous use of excluded codes

examples.code_example: Congenital heart defect vs Acquired heart disease

breakdown.Excludes1: Pure exclusion - cannot code both together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81)
breakdown.Congenital vs Acquired: Example of conditions that cannot occur together (Evidence: pg no: 9, L82)

examples.rationale: These represent mutually exclusive forms of conditions (Evidence: pg no: 9, L82)

warnings: Excludes1 codes should NEVER be used at the same time (Evidence: pg no: 9, L81-L82)
Two types of excludes notes have different rules (Evidence: pg no: 9, L79)
best_practices: Always check for Excludes notes before finalizing code selection
Understand the difference between Excludes1 and Excludes2
Verify conditions can coexist before assigning multiple codes
common_mistakes: Not distinguishing between Excludes1 and Excludes2
tips: Look for examples like congenital vs acquired
implementation_notes: Excludes notes prevent inappropriate code combinations
clinical_context: Reflects clinical reality of mutually exclusive conditions
